bug.short_desc: dnf check-updates accepts random command line options without generating an error. If a random option is specified non security options are not displayed.
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext: Description of problem: dnf check-updates accepts random command line options without generating an error. If a random option is specified non security options are not displayed. Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): dnf-1.1.10-4.fc25.noarch How reproducible: dnf check-updates -randomstring Steps to Reproduce: 1. dnf check-update -aaaaa Actual results: [root@matteo ~]# dnf check-update -a Last metadata expiration check: 0:02:21 ago on Sun Jan 1 17:01:08 2017. Expected results: Either an error since the -a option does not exist or the list of updates Last metadata expiration check: 0:02:18 ago on Sun Jan 1 17:01:08 2017. elfutils.x86_64 0.168-1.fc25 updates elfutils-default-yama-scope.noarch 0.168-1.fc25 updates elfutils-libelf.x86_64 0.168-1.fc25 updates elfutils-libs.x86_64 0.168-1.fc25 updates Additional info:
This problem was fixed in dnf-2.0.0 (worked correctly for me with dnf-2.0.0-0.rc2 version).
I don't think the bug fix should wait for F26. The fix should be back ported
Unfortunately we had to refactor whole argparsing thing and we can't push DNF 2.0 into stable releases.... https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Changes/DNF-2.0
